intro: Hieracium eriocerinthe subsp. candidum, commonly known as the white-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its subspecific name, *candidum*, refers to the white or pale coloration of its hairy parts.
